title_en: Sofia Taxi Drivers Hold An Indefinite Protest Due To Parking Problems - Novinite.com
summary_en:
Borisov and Fandakova were summoned to an extraordinary meeting of the metropolitan Municipal Council on May 23.
Bulgarian archaeologists have made remarkable discoveries during excavations in Sozopol.
A 5-year-old child from Kocherinovo tragically died during transportation to the hospital.
The new week in Bulgaria will begin with cloudy skies and possible rains, showers and thunderstorms.
44 universities in Bulgaria will not open their doors in protest.
The population of the European Union is 448.8 million people, Germany is the most populous country.
Bulgaria is one of the nine EU member states that have not signed the declaration in support of LGBTQ+ rights.
Construction of Sofia Airport Terminal 3 will begin in early 2026.
Bulgaria has the highest death rate from COVID-19 in the EU.

title: –ó–∞–±–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∫–∞: –§—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–∞: –æ–∫–æ–ª–æ 200 —Å–æ—Ç—Ä—É–¥–Ω–∏–∫–æ–≤ —É–≤–æ–ª—å–Ω—è—é—Ç—Å—è —Å —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç—ã
title_en: Strike: Frost: about 200 employees quit their jobs
summary_en:
Employees of the Frosta company from Bremerhaven quit due to a precautionary strike.
About 200 employees took part in the strike.
The early shift from 6:00 to 8:00 was affected.
NGG announced a strike with a warning.
The prerequisite is negotiations on a new housing and communal services agreement.
Frosta is proposing a wage increase that should exceed the inflation rate by 0.3 percent.
Wages should also be adjusted to take into account the high cost in the future.
With a 36-month contract, the company offers an additional 1,500 euros, with a 24-month contract - 1,000 euros.
The union is demanding a twelve percent pay increase for about 700 employees with a contract term of twelve months.

title: –í—Ç–æ—Ä–∞—è –∑–∞–±–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∫–∞ –≤ —Å—Ñ–µ—Ä–µ –≥–æ—Å—É–¥–∞—Ä—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–≥–æ –æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏—è –ú–∞–¥—Ä–∏–¥–∞ –Ω–∞–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–∏–≤ –°–æ–æ–±—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∞, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä–æ–µ –Ω–µ —Å–¥–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è
title_en: The second strike in Madrid's public education sector is aimed at a Community that does not give up
summary_en:
The second strike in the field of public education in Madrid is directed against the Community.
Trade unions are demanding shorter school hours, lower coefficients and better working conditions for teachers.
The Madrid community is reducing the number of requests to 23.4%, which is less than last time.
The largest demonstrations are taking place in a dozen municipalities of Madrid and in the capital.
The community argues that reducing the schedule for teachers is impossible due to the difficult economic situation.
The unions organized a strike and called two days of strike, one on May 8 and one on Tuesday, May 21.
Education remains open to dialogue, but now talks about a "global compact" that she will present to teachers.
Teachers of all ages and from all corners of the city protested, occupying one of the lanes in front of number 32 on Alcala Street.

title: –ú—É–Ω–∏—Ü–∏–ø–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ —Å–ª—É–∂–±—ã —ç–∫—Å—Ç—Ä–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–π –ø–æ–º–æ—â–∏: —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–Ω–∏–∫–∏ –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–µ—Å—Ç—É—é—Ç –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–∏–≤ —Ä–∞–±–æ—á–µ–≥–æ –≤—Ä–µ–º–µ–Ω–∏
title_en: Municipal emergency services: workers protest against working hours
summary_en:
Employees of the municipal emergency services in Kiel protested against the reduction of working hours.
The Verdi trade union called for a rally under the motto "A lifeguard in need" in several cities.
About 30 participants gathered in front of the branch of the Association of Municipal Employers in Kiel.
About 120 demonstrators gathered in Hanover.
The union requires 42 hours of maximum working time for emergency workers.
A disproportionately long working day makes working in an emergency service unattractive.
The action was the result of negotiations between the trade union and the Association of Municipal Employers' Associations in Berlin.

title: –ü–µ–¥–∞–≥–æ–≥–∏ —Å–µ–≥–æ–¥–Ω—è –≤—ã–π–¥—É—Ç –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–µ—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∞—Ç—å, –Ω–æ –æ—Ç—Å—Ç–∞–≤–∫–∏ –º–∏–Ω–∏—Å—Ç—Ä–∞ –ø–æ–∫–∞ –Ω–µ –ø–æ—Ç—Ä–µ–±—É—é—Ç
title_en: Teachers will come out to protest today, but they will not demand the resignation of the minister yet
summary_en:
The teachers plan to protest, but do not yet demand the resignation of the minister.
The department wants to balance the workload of teachers so that they do not overwork and burn out.
Every hour of teachers' work will be paid and paid for.
Discussions should include local governments and principals, as much depends on the actions of school leaders.
The agency's proposal is completely the opposite of the one that LIZDA and the Ministry of Education and Science argued about last year.
According to the methodology proposed by the Ministry of Education and Science, teachers can lose from several tens to several hundred euros per month.
The trade union does not demand the resignation of the minister, but requires the continuation of work on balancing the teachers' rate.

title_en: In Paris, railway workers staged protests demanding bonuses in connection with the OI
summary_en:
Railway workers in Paris are protesting against the Olympic Games, demanding bonuses and financial compensation.
The mass strike was organized by employees of the National Railway Company (SNCF) at the call of the Sud-Rail trade union.
Workers gathered in Trocadero Square, unfurling a poster with the inscription "There is no Olympic Games without railway workers."
The strike led to serious traffic difficulties on some RER D and R Transilien lines.
More than 50% of French residents believe that the country is not ready to host the Olympic and Paralympic Games in Paris.
On the opening day of the Olympic Games, airspace will be closed over Paris and car traffic will be restricted.

title: –ü—è—Ç—ã–π –¥–µ–Ω—å –æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–æ–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ–π –∑–∞–±–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∫–∏ –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–∏–≤ –ê—é—Å–æ –º–æ–±–∏–ª–∏–∑—É–µ—Ç —Å–µ–º—å –∏–∑ –¥–µ—Å—è—Ç–∏ —É—á–∏—Ç–µ–ª–µ–π
title_en: The fifth day of the educational strike against Ayuso mobilizes seven out of ten teachers
summary_en:
Hundreds of people gathered in front of the Ministry of Education in Madrid for a teacher strike.
The requirements include shortening school hours, equalizing wages, and lowering coefficients.
The number of participants in the strike increased by 67%, which is two points more than in the previous year.
The protesters chanted various slogans, expressing their demands.
Trade unions are the organizers of the strike, which is joined by various organizations.
The requirements relate to reducing school hours, equalizing wages and reducing coefficients.
The Madrid government is seeking to conclude a "global compact" with the education unions.

title: –î–≤–∏–∂–µ–Ω–∏–µ: –≤–æ–¥–∏—Ç–µ–ª–∏ –∞–≤—Ç–æ–±—É—Å–æ–≤ –ø—Ä–æ–¥–æ–ª–∂–∞—é—Ç –∑–∞–±–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∫—É: –ø–µ—Ä–µ–±–æ–∏ –≤ —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–µ –ø–æ –≤—Å–µ–º—É –ì–µ—Å—Å–µ–Ω—É
title_en: Traffic: Bus drivers continue to strike: work disruptions across Hesse
summary_en:
The Verdi trade union continues warning strikes at private bus companies in Hesse.
The strikes should continue on Wednesday.
The NVV and RMV transport associations report disruptions in various regions of Hesse.
Urban transportation in Kassel, Darmstadt and Wiesbaden remains largely on the sidelines.
There were almost no buses in Frankfurt, but customers could still transfer to different trains.
The first warning strike of bus drivers was announced on April 24.
The union is demanding an 8.5 percent pay increase for approximately 6,000 employees in two phases each.
Employers rejected the claims as unfundable and offered 9.3 percent more money in three phases.

title: –†–∞–±–æ—Ç–Ω–∏–∫–∏ –¥–µ—Ç—Å–∫–∏—Ö —Å–∞–¥–æ–≤, —Å–≤—è–∑–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–µ —Å CSQ, –æ–¥–æ–±—Ä—è—é—Ç –º–∞–Ω–¥–∞—Ç –Ω–∞ "–ø—Ä–æ–≥—Ä–µ—Å—Å–∏–≤–Ω—É—é –∑–∞–±–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∫—É"
title_en: Kindergarten workers affiliated with CSQ approve mandate for "progressive strike"
summary_en:
Employees of public kindergartens (CPE) in the CSQ trade union voted 85% in favor of holding a "progressive strike".
A possible progressive strike would begin with the opening of outlets half an hour later than usual, then an hour, then two hours, and so on, up to half a working day.
However, according to Valerie Grenon, president of the Federation of Small Defense Interventionists (FIPEQ), the strike notification has not yet been sent.
The FIPEQ unions have 3,000 members who work for CPE in various regions.
At the moment, there can be no question of an unlimited general strike.
CPE workers in Quebec are offering a 12.7% salary increase over five years.
Negotiations have just begun, although the collective agreements expired on March 31, 2023.

title_en: Thousands of protesters defy the rain in Madrid, demanding better conditions in public education
summary_en:
Thousands of protesters are demanding better working conditions for teachers and increased investment in classrooms.
The second day of the strike in the state non-university education ended with a large demonstration.
The march started from Neptune and continued along the Paseo del Prado to Cibeles.
The unions have led a protest demanding funding for the measures they are demanding.
The protesters' demands include shortening school hours, lowering coefficients, equalizing wages and increasing attention to diversity.
The second day of the strike was marked by more than 67% according to trade unions and 23.4% according to the regional government.
